facts.text: Los Angeles Football Club (LAFC) was established on October 30, 2014.
LAFC began play in Major League Soccer (MLS) in the 2018 season as an expansion team.
The team plays its home matches at BMO Stadium, located in Exposition Park, Los Angeles.
The managing owners of LAFC are Brandon Beck, Larry Berg, and Bennett Rosenthal.
Bob Bradley served as LAFC's inaugural head coach from 2017 to 2021, before being replaced by Steven Cherundolo.
In 2019, LAFC won the Supporters' Shield and club captain Carlos Vela earned the MVP Award.
LAFC won their first MLS Cup in 2022, completing a league double with their second Supporters' Shield.
LAFC were runners-up in the CONCACAF Champions League in 2020 and 2023.
In 2024, LAFC won their first Lamar Hunt U.S. Open Cup.
Notable players who have played for LAFC include Gareth Bale, Olivier Giroud, Hugo Lloris, and Carlos Vela.
Carlos Vela was signed as LAFC's first designated player on August 11, 2017.
LAFC played its first MLS game on March 4, 2018, winning 1–0 against Seattle Sounders FC.
Diego Rossi scored LAFC's first competitive goal in their first MLS game.
LAFC won 4 of the 6 games on their road trip to start the 2018 season, becoming the first team to earn 12 points from a season-opening road trip of 6 games or more.
LAFC finished the 2018 season with 7 road wins, the most for an expansion team in the post-shootout era.
In the 2018 season, LAFC earned 57 points, the best regular season for an MLS expansion team at the time.
LAFC clinched its first playoff spot on October 6, 2018, after a 3–0 victory against the Colorado Rapids.
Los Angeles FC advanced to the 2023 CONCACAF Champions League final for their second time in four years.
Los Angeles FC faced Club León in the 2023 CONCACAF Champions League final.
In the 2023 CONCACAF Champions League final, Los Angeles FC lost to Club León with an aggregate score of 3–1.
LAFC acquired Lewis O'Brien, Eduard Atuesta, Olivier Giroud, Hugo Lloris, David Martinez, Kei Kamara, and Maxime Chanot for the 2024 season.
LAFC clinched the Western Conference (Regular season) by goal difference against the LA Galaxy in the 2024 season.
LAFC's unbeaten streak during the 2024 season lasted for 13 games.
LAFC reached the final of the 2024 Leagues Cup but lost to Columbus Crew 3–1.
LAFC was defeated by Seattle Sounders FC in the 2024 MLS Cup playoffs, ending their season.
LAFC qualified for the 2024 U.S. Open Cup and began their campaign in the Round of 32.

LAFC defeated Seattle Sounders FC in the semifinal round of the 2024 U.S. Open Cup, making them the third team to beat the Sounders at Starfire Sports Complex where the Sounders had a record of 25–1–3.
LAFC's first ever game was a 1-0 win against Seattle Sounders FC on March 4, 2018.
LAFC's first home game at Banc of California Stadium resulted in a 1-0 win over Seattle Sounders FC with a 92nd-minute goal by Laurent Ciman.
In the 2019 Western Conference Finals, Seattle Sounders FC defeated LAFC for the first time.
In 2024, LAFC defeated the Seattle Sounders 1-0 in the U.S. Open Cup semifinals, preventing Seattle from winning their 5th U.S. Open Cup.
From 2023, every LAFC match is available via MLS Season Pass on the Apple TV app.
LAFC's locally broadcast matches were televised in English by KCOP in 2021 and 2022.
YouTube TV was the first online streaming service to carry live games for a major U.S. professional sports team, doing so for LAFC from 2018 to 2020.
Before the deal with Apple, LAFC's locally broadcast matches were televised in Spanish on Estrella TV station KRCA.
LAFC's English radio broadcasts are provided by KSPN (ESPNLA 710) with Dave Denholm as the play-by-play announcer.
In 2016, Brandon Beck, Larry Berg, and Bennett Rosenthal took over as managing owners of LAFC, with Berg serving as lead managing owner.
Peter Guber is the executive chairman of LAFC as of 2017.
Will Ferrell, Nomar Garciaparra, Mia Hamm-Garciaparra, Magic Johnson, and Giorgio Chiellini are among the part-owners and investors of LAFC.
Tom Penn served as LAFC's first president until stepping down on August 18, 2020.
In February 2020, LAFC owners began the process of buying out a 20 percent ownership stake held by Vincent Tan, valuing the club at $700 million, the largest on record for an MLS team at that time.
LAFC launched a reserve team, Los Angeles FC 2, for the 2023 season of MLS Next Pro.
The LAFC Academy was founded on February 1, 2016.
LAFC's U-13 squad won the CONCACAF Champions League on August 21, 2018.
LAFC signed its first three Homegrown players from the academy on July 8, 2020.
Toni Hernandez was hired as the Academy Director for LAFC on June 9, 2025.
Orange County SC was affiliated with Los Angeles FC from December 7, 2016, until after the 2018 season.
LAFC's partnership with Las Vegas Lights FC started on March 12, 2021, and ended in 2023.
LAFC took a minority stake in NWSL side Angel City FC on October 8, 2024.
LAFC won their first major MLS trophy, the Supporters' Shield, in 2019 with a record-breaking 72 points.
LAFC won the MLS Cup in 2022 over the Philadelphia Union.
LAFC won their first U.S. Open Cup in 2024 with a 3–1 victory against Sporting Kansas City.
Chicago Fire FC won the MLS Cup in their inaugural season, 1998.
LA Galaxy has won the MLS Cup five times: in 2002, 2005, 2011, 2012, and 2014.
New England Revolution won the Supporters' Shield in 2002, 2005, 2006, and 2007 consecutively.
Toronto FC won the Supporters' Shield in both 2017 and 2019.
The 2022 MLS Cup was won by Los Angeles FC.
The 2024 Supporters' Shield was won by New York Red Bulls.
Seattle Sounders FC won the MLS Cup in 2016, 2019, and 2020.
Diego Rossi won the MLS Young Player of the Year Award in 2020.
Bradley Wright-Phillips was named the MLS Comeback Player of the Year in 2020.
Diego Palacios received the CCL Best Young Player Award in 2020.
Cristian Arango was awarded the MLS Newcomer of the Year Award in 2021.
John McCarthy was named the MLS Cup MVP in 2022.
John McCarthy won the CCL Golden Glove Award in 2023.
Bob Bradley received the Sigi Schmid Coach of the Year Award in 2019.
John Thorrington was named the MLS Sporting Executive Of The Year in 2024.
Carlos Vela was the top goalscorer for the 2019 season with 38 goals.
Denis Bouanga was the top goalscorer for the 2023 season with 37 goals.
Carlos Vela has the highest total goals for the team with 93 goals.
Hugo Lloris, despite being a goalkeeper, scored a total of 24 goals across different competitions.
